extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.original: 2 pounds large shrimp, peeled and deveined

title: Saffron Shrimp with Fennel Seeds
summary: Saffron Shrimp with Fennel Seeds might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe makes 6 servings with 190 calories, 31g of protein, and 2g of fat each. For $3.8 per serving, this recipe covers 18% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. It is a good option if you're following a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal diet. A mixture of garlic cloves, fennel seeds, flat-leaf parsley, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so yummy. To use up the salt you could follow this main course with the Apple Turnovers Recipe as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 52%. This score is good. Similar recipes include Saffron Poached Shrimp with Shaved Fennel and Citrus Vinaigrette, Toasted Orzo with Saffron and Fennel, and Roasted Carrots With Fennel Seeds.

winePairing.pairingText: Shrimp on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. The Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Straw yellow hue, accompanied by a close-focused nose of pear, apricot and white flowers. The fruity palate, with top notes of stone fruit, shows ripeness and roundness well supported by an elegant acidity and savoriness, ensuring a long, lingering finish.

instructions: Combine first 5 ingredients in a large nonstick skillet; bring to a boil. Cook 5 minutes; add shrimp. Cover and cook 2 minutes or until shrimp are done, stirring occasionally. Spoon mixture into a bowl, and chill. Stir in parsley before serving.

steps.step: Combine first 5 ingredients in a large nonstick skillet; bring to a boil. Cook 5 minutes; add shrimp. Cover and cook 2 minutes or until shrimp are done, stirring occasionally. Spoon mixture into a bowl, and chill. Stir in parsley before serving.
